discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct answer: D

For Teams Communications Support Specialist,

Can do these tasks
Troubleshoot communications issues within Teams by using basic tools. 

Can access the following tools
1. Access user profile page for troubleshooting calls in Call Analytics. Can only view user information for the specific user being searched for.
2. Access, monitor, and troubleshoot tenant's call quality and reliability using data exposed in Call Quality Dashboard (CQD).

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/using-admin-roles

This is a similar question to Q25

comments.content: I was skeptical but after assigning Teams Communication Support Specialist, I was not able to choose/find Usage Reports in TAC...

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Office 365 subscription that contains a user named User1.

You need to ensure that User1 can view Usage reports in the Microsoft Teams admin center. The solution must use the principle of least privilege.

Which role should you assign to User1?

discussion.content:
the answers look correct: Debug logs show Login, Connection requests to middle-tier services, Call/conversation and Media logs contain diagnostic data about audio, video, and screen sharing in Teams meetings.
See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/log-files

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Your company uses Teams.

Two users named User1 and User2 use the Teams client for Windows.

The users report the following issues:

• User1 reports that when attempting to sign in, the Teams client remains on the sign-in page.
• User2 reports receiving an error when attempting to screen share during a Teams meeting.

You need to troubleshoot the issues.

Which client-side log should you review for each user? To answer, drag the appropriate logs to the correct users. Each log may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

DRAG DROP
-

Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Teams.

A user named User1 reports the following issues:

• User1 cannot schedule a live event by using the Teams client.
• User1 experiences only one-way audio during a Teams call.

You need to troubleshoot the issues.

Which client-side log should you review for each issue? To answer, drag the appropriate logs to the correct issues. Each log may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Reporting labels are used to give an IP subnet a name that links it to a physical location such as offices, buildings, or organizational sites within your organization. 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/learn-more-about-site-upload

comments.content: yes, looks correct here too: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-call-analytics as you upload the reporting labels

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Teams.

You need to upload network IP subnet information to call analytics.

What should you configure?

Your company uses Teams.

A user named User1 reports audio issues in meetings.

You suspect that the issues were caused by an audio device or audio device driver.

You need to identify which device and driver were used during past meetings.

What should you do in the Microsoft Teams admin center?

choices.D: From Usage reports, review the Teams device usage report
choices.B: From Manage users, review the Meetings & Calls tab.
choices.A: From Usage reports, review the Teams user activity report.
choices.C: From Manage users, review the Teams devices tab.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer is B: Manage Users > Select User 1 > select meetings and calls tab > scroll down to past meetings > select the meeting ID > click on participant details tab > click on the start time. The window that opens shows the devices used and the associated drivers.

Selected Answer: B
Usage reports only specifies which OS is used
